insights_for_incidences: Files appearing on Sunday (consistently zero in historical data) would be anomalous.
Files with formats other than CSV (100% CSV historically) would be anomalous.
Significant deviations from entity-specific volume patterns would be anomalous.
Expect consistent batch uploads Tuesday-Saturday during 08:00-08:13 UTC. Deviations would be anomalous.
Wednesday consistently shows highest volume (1,390,931.64 avg rows). Significant deviations from this would be anomalous.
Monday shows minimal activity (mean 1 file overall) with wider time window (08:06-17:21 UTC). Deviations from this minimal activity would be anomalous.
Beneficios shows unusual Friday spike pattern (14.60 files vs. typical 1-2 files). Deviations from this pattern would be anomalous.
Teste entity appears only on Tuesdays with minimal data (21 rows). Deviations from this pattern would be anomalous.
High empty file rate is expected on Monday and Tuesday (>80%).
Wednesday is the peak volume day with highest multi-part activity.
Non-empty files are consistently capped at 150,000 rows.
Upload lag is typically between +1 and +3 days.
Uploads generally occur between 07:30-15:30 UTC.
Absence of weekend processing would be anomalous.
File consistency: One file per day pattern is expected.
Uploads are consistently 3 days after the reference date.
No empty files are expected; minimum 517 rows per file.
Daily uploads are consistent with no gaps exceeding one day.
